attributes.action: Include white privilege, historic & current racism in the PSHE curriculum
attributes.additional_details: White privilege and systematic racism are misunderstood & often not discussed. In order to achieve true equality & inclusion we must understand the differences we all have. Many students will receive some education of this at home but as educators we have a responsibility to ensure all young people are aware of these terms, their meanings and the impact on our society it has. Developing more awareness of this will have a positive impact on our society to help us become more united and inclusive
attributes.background:
Include definitions of white privilege and systematic racism in the curriculum 

Add racial microagressions and discussion points of the importance of language

Add significant historical events and legislation changes 

Consult with BAME academics and activists with  regards as to the content

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality
